reviewText: Bride of Re-Animator (R, 1990, 96 minutes)-It's been eight months since the Miskatonic Massacre stained the halls with blood - and Dr. West and Dr. Cain's experiments have taken a bizarre turn. Now they have gone beyond re-animating the dead...into the realm of creating new life. The legs of a hooker and the womb of a virgin are joined to the heart of Dr. Cain's dead girlfriend - and the bride is unleashed upon her mate in a climax of sensual horror.My Review: Believe it or not, it wasn't until recently that I was introduced to Re-Animator. I'd heard about through the years but had never seen it. So, when the zombie craze hit in, I decided to pick it up because everyone I knew kept recommending it. Glad I did because I was blown away by it. One of my favorites of all-time. Despite the fact that BroR-A isn't as great as the original, it's still a good movie.  A decent followup. Course, it's kind of hard to top the first one. Still, if you're a Re-Animator fan, you're going to want to add this one.Beyond Re-Animator (R, 2003, 95 minutes)-The mental maggot Dr. Herbert West may be in prison but his deranged mind is not in check. From his cell, he conducts his experiments on all that is available rats and in doing so, garners the attention of a new young prison doctor.My Review: This, perhaps, is my favorite out of the sequels. While still nowhere as good as the original and made on a lower budget, it's still a fun followup that fans of the series will enjoy.Return of the Living Dead 3 (R, 1993, 97 minutes)-Once again,  a force of evil, slow-moving, flesh-eaters are on the loose to terrorize an even slower-moving band of teenagers.My Review:It's a much better sequel, considering it's played more serious. However, fans of the first two and the darker humor that was in those movies will probably dislike it. You may also like to know that this movie isn't the unrated version. At any rate, it's still a good movie and a deal with this collection.Return of the Living Dead: Necropolis (R, 2005, 88 minutes)-A group of high school kids discovers that a megacorporation has been conducting experiments on humans, using a mutated chemical compound that reanimates the dead.My Review: Out of all the RotLD movies, this movie and its' followup are the least liked. The reason being is that:1)It, in no way, bears any resemblance to the series previous installments nor does it share anything with those movies(other than the reference to Trioxin). As far as it being your garden variety zombie movie, it's okay. If this were released under a different title, this movie may have had a chance.Return of the Living Dead: Rave to the Grave (R, 2005, 86 minutes)-A college student finds a canister in his uncle's attic that contains a drug more potent than Ecstasy. When word of the drug, nicknamed "Z" for its Zombie-like hallucinogenic effects, reaches unscrupulous college drug dealer Skeet, he hatches a plan to sell the drug to ravers attending the ultimate rave party. But when the drug's side effects start to kick in, the ultimate rave turns into the ultimate grave as party goers drop to their death...then rise again to feed!My Review: Although slightly better than RotLD:Necropolis, RotLD: Rave to the Grave is decent as a zombie movie but not a decent RotLD movie. Still a good dealas part of this collection, though.Night of the Living Dead 2D (R, 2006, 80 minutes)-Thrilling re-imagining of George Romero's classic terror flick follows beautiful Barb as she and her brother show up late at their aunt's burial service. When her sibling is killed by a flesh-starved zombie, she is rescued by a local college student. Taking shelter in a nearby farmhouse, Barb must deal with problems caused by her fellow refugees and a dangerous mortician.My Review: To be completely honest, this movie is the only reason why I purchased this collection in the first place.See, months ago, I bought its' sequel: Night of the Living Dead 3D: Re-Animation. I don't know about you but , when I get a movie that has another movie in its' series, I prefer to get them and have them in the collection, regardless of whether they're great movies or not. Long story short, I searched and searched and couldn't find this movie. When I found it in this collection, I decided to get it. My feelings about NotLD2D? It's a pretty decent flick, actually. I've always felt this series would have benefit alot more if they didn't use the NotLD title. This movie and its' sequel centers around Gerald Tovar, Jr. Looking back at my original review for this movie, I was too critical with it, simply because I felt it was making a mockery of the original NotLD by having the Gerald Tovar, Jr. backstory. Honestly, though, on it's own merits, it's a good film. The only thing from my original review that I stand by in reviewing is that what made the original and the first remake so great was the feeling of isolation you got from your surroundings, that was THE mistake in this film. I had a hard time feeling as though I was far away from anywhere in this movie in the way it was told.  Other than that, looking at the movie  now--I recommend it. It's a decent zombie flick.Overall, if you love zombie movies...this collection isn't a bad purchase. Honestly, little gripes aside, I never saw one movie in this collection that was a major disappoint to me.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is not a bad two discs set for the price.Here we get:Bride of Re-Animator (R, 1990, 96 minutes)Beyond  Re-Animator (R, 2003, 95 minutes)Return of the Living Dead 3 (R, 1993, 97 minutes)Return of the Living Dead: Necropolis (R, 2005, 88 minutes)Return of the Living Dead: Rave to the Grave (R, 2005, 86 minutes)Night of the Living Dead 2D (R, 2006, 80 minutes)I'm a big Zombie fan and this collection has two great movies, one decent movie and three below-average flicks. Bride of Re-Animator is the best out of the six, but once again we get the R rated version and not the uncut version. The same goes for it's lackluster sequel, Beyond Re-Animator. The underrated Return of the Living Dead 3 is the Rated R version instead of the uncut version that had came out on VHS years ago. The other three zombie flicks are low-budget sequels/remakes that are times painful to watch. I would only recommend those three for die-hard fans of both series as you might want to add them to your collection.

reviewText: Well if you are looking for zombies and you don't hold high standards on this genre then well yes I guess you can buy this collection. Keep in mind all em feature C list actors who barely have any acting experience or none at all. Try not to delve too much into plot or reality as you will find that these movies tend to defy both. But if cheesey and unbelievable stunts and dialogue is your thing then this collection should probably belong in your shelf.
summary: A quick zombie fix but not a zombie fan fantasy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Awesome movie compilation at a fantastic price for this set. Here you have the Re-animator trilogy, Return Of The Living Dead (3-5), and the 2006 re-make of Night Of The Living Dead. How can you beat that for 5 bucks. All of the movies are pretty good, and the DVD quality is up to par. This set is money well spent. I wish Lionsgate would still do a few more of these types of sets. They did a few different ones that year, but nothing close like this again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Until we get an uncut version of ROTLD 3 this is a waste of a compilation. Not to mention Bride of Re-Animator is still censored like the release Lionsgate put out years ago. Do yourself a favor & try to pick up the Pionner release of Bride. Both versions included & great extras. For now I'll stick with my uncut VHS of ROTLD 3 & Pioneer copy of Bride. PS... this collection is only 2 discs, NOT 6 discs like amazons specs say. They have a habit of posting false info.

reviewText: This movie collection is a great deal. This 6 movie collection is full of good horror movies. I love all of the return of the living dead movies. You have return of the living dead 3 and rave to the grave. I like them both.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This movie collection isn't terrible, you get 6 movies and the quality of each is to be expected of a standard dvd, no graininess but also they're not of the highest quality. The downside is that there are no menus and no special features either. My main complaint stems from the fact that Return Of The Living Dead 3 is heavily edited. Now, i'm not talking a little bit of gore cut out but all nudity has been cut out of the movie as well as most of the gore. I personally bought this for return of the living dead 3 and am very upset at the editing of the film, and I've never seen the UK/unrated version. Buy this collection if you want the movies only, just be prepared for a scaled back version of return of the living dead 3.
